**Infestation** is a level 8 [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") spell that applies the **Infested** status to monsters in a 5x5 area. A friendly [death scarab](/Death_scarab "Death scarab") erupts out of each victim that dies.

Infestation can be obtained as part of [Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha")'s 6\* piety gift.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Applies the Infested status to monsters within a [smite-targeted](/Smite-targeted "Smite-targeted") 5x5 area. You can infest monsters from outside [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"). Any infested monster which dies will turn into a [death scarab](/Death_scarab "Death scarab"). Monster [holiness](/Holiness "Holiness") does not matter; [undead](/Undead "Undead"), [demonic](/Demonic "Demonic"), and [non-living](/Non-living "Non-living") monsters can all be infested. Only monsters worth [XP](/XP "XP"), or monsters created by [Kikubaaqudgha](/Kikubaaqudgha "Kikubaaqudgha")'s Unearth Wretches ability, can be infested.

Scarabs' strength and duration does not scale with spellpower. Scarabs aren't [derived undead](/Derived_undead "Derived undead"), so it does not scale with the host's strength, either. Scarabs last for around 81 turns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Infestation takes priority over all other [undead-creating](/Necromancy#Undead_Creation "Necromancy") Necromancy spells. It can work alongside [Death Channel](/Death_Channel "Death Channel"), but overrides other effects. It even takes priority over [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag")'s gold touch and [Yredelemnul](/Yredelemnul "Yredelemnul")'s reaping (scarabs replace gold / zombies, respectively).

## Strategy

[Death scarabs](/Death_scarab "Death scarab") are great allies; they are very fast, [slow](/Slow "Slow") down enemies, are undead, and deal great damage. They also last for a fairly long time, letting you Infest new monsters you encounter. Compared to other undead-creating spells, Infestation has the advantage of working on undead, demonic, and non-living monsters.

Infest the weaker monsters in a crowd and kill them quickly in order to spawn a bunch of scarabs. Use spells like [Borgnjor's Vile Clutch](/Borgnjor%27s_Vile_Clutch "Borgnjor's Vile Clutch"), [Haunt](/Haunt "Haunt"), and [Anguish](/Anguish "Anguish") (when combined with other, existing [undead](/Undead "Undead")) to start the horde.

### Tips & Tricks

- [Kiku](/Kiku "Kiku")'s Unearth Wretches places necromantic fodder in a 5x5 area, which corresponds perfectly to Infestation's radius. You can use Unearth Wretches twice, then Infestation on top of the player character. This is bound to create a large swarm, capable of tackling the game's most dangerous encounters.
- Death scarabs cannot [see invisible](/See_invisible "See invisible") - a notable weakness considering the prevalence of [Invisibility](/Invisibility "Invisibility")-casting [liches](/Lich "Lich") in the late game.

## History

- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), scarabs worked alongside all other undead-creating spells.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), scarabs had a [duration class](/Duration_class "Duration class") of 6 (\~171 turns).
- This spell was added in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [fineff.cc:697](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/fineff.cc#L697) (0.31.0)  
   \* A [summon duration](/Summon#summon_duration "Summon") of 5 is about 81 turns.
